conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle in both magnetic fields using given conditions.
Particle is injected into the magnetic field with velocity v0 at an angle of 45° to MN.
Particle will move in a circular path with radius R due to perpendicular magnetic field.
Horizontal component of initial velocity is v0x = v0 / sqrt(2).
Vertical component of initial velocity is v0y = v0 / sqrt(2).
Radius of circular path is R = mv0 / qB.
Collision with plate reverses horizontal velocity direction while maintaining magnitude.
Horizontal component of velocity after collision is v_x' = -v0 / sqrt(2).
Vertical component of velocity after collision is v_y' = v0 / sqrt(2).
Particle continues circular motion with same radius R.
Trajectory is symmetric about vertical line through center of circular path.
Particle travels 2d horizontally before leaving magnetic field region.
Particle completes half a circle in first region and travels horizontally to edge of second region.
Horizontal distance traveled in one complete circle is 2πR.
Distance 2d equals half the circumference of the circle: 2d = πR.
Solve for R: R = d / π.
Substitute R into expression for R: d / π = mv0 / qB.
Solve for B: B = mv0π / qd.
Magnitude of magnetic induction B is mv0π / qd.
